TITLE: Tim Walz vs. JD Vance: What the 2024 presidential running mates could mean for your wallet
SUMMARY: Here's how Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance compare on key personal finance issues like housing, the child tax credit and student loans.

TITLE: Trump wants to cut taxes on Social Security — but it could threaten benefits, experts say
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump this week repeated his plan to eliminate taxes on Social Security benefits. But the plan could threaten entitlements, experts say.

TITLE: Biden administration's student loan relief plan may be paused for 'months or even a year,' expert says
SUMMARY: The Biden administration's new affordable repayment plan, known as SAVE, may be on hold for months amid a slew of legal challenges. What borrowers should know.

SUMMARY: Debby, now a post-tropical storm, is expected to soak more of the U.S. this weekend. Flood insurance likely won't cover things kept in your basement.

TITLE: The unemployment insurance program is unprepared for a recession, experts say
SUMMARY: Unemployment insurance is meant to prop up income after a layoff. The system buckled during the pandemic and is ill equipped for another crisis, experts said.

TITLE: Average consumer now carries $6,329 in credit card debt. 'People are stretched,'  expert says
SUMMARY: Americans are racking up credit card debt and increasingly falling behind on their payments, recent reports show.

SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris' new running mate Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz cut state taxes on Social Security. Here's how it's different from Trump's plan.

TITLE: Clean energy tax breaks more popular than expected, as U.S. households claimed $8.4 billion in Inflation Reduction Act credits for 2023, officials say
SUMMARY: Two tax credits enhanced and extended by the Inflation Reduction Act are more popular than officials projected.

TITLE: Nearly half of student loan borrowers are expecting debt forgiveness, Sallie Mae report finds
SUMMARY: Nearly half of student loan borrowers are anticipating debt forgiveness in the future. Here's how that might happen.

TITLE: Here’s how families are covering the rising cost of college
SUMMARY: To cover the rising cost of college, most families have to rely on a combination of resources. This year, student loans are making up a larger share.

SUMMARY: Recession risks have risen but the U.S. is likely to skirt a downturn if the Federal Reserve soon cuts interest rates, economists said.

SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris picked Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz as her running mate, a choice that could highlight the child tax credit, experts say.

TITLE: Now is the time to 'buy things on sale' in the stock market, advisor says. Here's what to know
SUMMARY: While bad days in the market can induce fears, it's important to stick to your long-term financial goals and continue to invest, experts say.

TITLE: This labor data trend is a 'warning sign,' economist says. Here's why
SUMMARY: Marginally attached workers are people who want a job, but are having a significantly hard time finding one. An increase of this cohort can mean trouble.

SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education is still finalizing its new student loan forgiveness plan. Here are the four groups likely to benefit.

SUMMARY: Credit card balances rose in the second quarter of 2024, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York found.

SUMMARY: Amid stock market volatility, it's critical to avoid emotional moves that could stunt long-term portfolio growth, financial experts say. Here's what to know.

SUMMARY: Financial compensation for flight delay and cancelation varies by airline.

TITLE: So much for TikTok's 'underconsumption' trend, as back-to-school shopping hits its stride
SUMMARY: TikTok's latest hashtag trend comes surprisingly swiftly on the heels of a movement meant to resist overconsumption.

SUMMARY: Underconsumption is not just a fad, it’s a movement that often goes hand in hand with the start of a economic slowdown.

TITLE: 23% of low-income Americans are living without a bank account
SUMMARY: While 6% of Americans overall are unbanked, 23% of adults making less than $25,000 are living without a bank account.

TITLE: 72% of Americans worry Social Security will run out in their lifetimes. Here's what experts say
SUMMARY: Experts say chances are slim that Social Security benefits will go away completely.

TITLE: Trump promises lower interest rates. But he doesn't have that power
SUMMARY: Former President Donald Trump promised to lower interest rates if reelected. But the Fed, which sets the key rate, operates independently from the White House.

SUMMARY: More than 80% of recent homebuyers said they regret their purchase, according to a recent Clever Real Estate survey.
